# Data process


## Cuba

### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description




| **Name** | `TOILET`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Difficulty with using toilet`|
| **Table name** |`1066-Cuba-Baseline`|
| **Categories** |`0 = no problems`<br/>`1 = occasionally wets bed`<br/>`2 = frequently wets bed`<br/>`3 = double adl_toilet`|
| **Missings** |`NA`|
| **Description** |  |









```{r assign Cuba w1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 's1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline', variables=list('TOILET'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local Cuba w1,  echo=FALSE}
s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet <- opal.execute(o,'s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet')
vari <- s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$TOILET

kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)

kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet, aes(x=factor(TOILET))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Difficulty using the toilet") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 1` 
* `1 into 0`
* `2 into 0` 
* `3 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:** 
```{r harmo Cuba w1,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet <- car::recode(s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$TOILET, "0 = '1';1='0';2 = '0';3='0';NA='999'")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet, labels = c(Yes=0, No=1,Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript Cuba w1,  echo=FALSE}


vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet # variable you want to descrive
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3])
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")


ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(adl_toilet))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("ADL - Difficulty using the toilet") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation Cuba w1,  echo=FALSE}
AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet)
X<-table(s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$TOILET)
nas<-length(s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$TOILET)-length(na.omit(s1066_Cuba_w1_adl_toilet$TOILET))
BeforeH <-c(sum(X[2:4]),X[1],nas)
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("1,2,3->0","0->1","NA->999")
kable(C)
```






```{r importOPAL Cuba w1, echo=FALSE,  echo=FALSE}
val_labels(t1066_ds_cuba_w1) <- NULL
label(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet) <- "Difficulties for using the toilet"
opal.assign.data(o, 't1066_ds_cuba_w1', t1066_ds_cuba_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'t1066_ds_cuba_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')

t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1 <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet <- car::recode(t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1$adl_toilet, "c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997,998, 999)=NA")
opal.assign.data(o, 't1066_m_ds_cuba_w1', t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1)
#opal.symbol_import(o,'t1066_m_ds_cuba_w1', project='_Athlos_Harm_Dataset')
```

```{r,  echo=FALSE}
adl_toilet <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1
save(adl_toilet, file = paste0(datafolder, "/cuba_w1/adl_toilet.RData"))
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonize variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `0 into 1` 
* `1 into 0`
* `2 into 0` 
* `3 into 0`
* `NA into 999`

**R script:** 
```{r harmo PuertoRico w2,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_PR_w2 <- tibble(id=s1066_PuertoRico_w2_adl_toilet$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w2$adl_toilet <-  car::recode(s1066_PuertoRico_w2_adl_toilet$f_TOILET, "0 = '1';1='0';2 = '0';3='0';NA='999'")
t1066_ds_PR_w2$adl_toilet <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w2$adl_toilet, labels = c(Yes=0, No=1,Missing=999, Do_not_know=998, Refuse=997, Not_applicable=996, Does_not_answer=995,  Not_attempt_not_done=994, Disable_to_measure=993, Impute=992, CAPI_interviewer_error=991))
```

## Descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable:




```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
    aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
    # Labelling of variables
    label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label
    # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
    l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
    aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
    # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
    aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:2])
  # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
    m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
    rm(aux_object)
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}

# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[13,] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}


```
